meanings.definition: A unit of mass equal to one millionth of a gram.
meanings.sent1: She measured the medicine in micrograms to ensure the correct dosage.
meanings.sent2: The scientist weighed the sample in micrograms using a precise scale.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally spilled a microgram of sugar into my coffee, making it too sweet.
meanings.sent4: The importance of her contribution to the project was not even a microgram compared to his.
meanings.sent5: The microgram of dust on the bookshelf caught the sunlight, sparkling like tiny diamonds.

meanings.definition: A very small amount of something.
meanings.sent1: Every microgram of effort she put into her studies paid off in the end.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't detect even a microgram of doubt in her confident voice.
meanings.sent3: The chef added a microgram of spice to the dish, creating a burst of flavor.
meanings.sent4: Her smile brightened the room by a microgram, spreading warmth to everyone present.
meanings.sent5: The microgram of kindness he showed towards the stray cat made a big difference in its day.
